docTitle.titlePart:
Homogeneous Time-Resolved Fluorescence
Part 2: Ratio & data reduction

front.div:
Homogeneous Time-resolved Fluorescence (HTRF
Â®
) assays are
straightforward to perform. They do not require a separation or wash step.
To reduce the potential interference from biological media or compounds
left in the plate during detection, we have patented an HTRF ratiometric
data reduction. Further, the ratiometric value allows the end user to look
at multiple aspects of the data generated. Additional calculations and
methods of data reduction will be described in this application note.
